boat.full_description:
Owned by H.D. BROWN KELLY of Lochgoilhead. Designed by Ewing MoGRUER on the lines of a Loch Fyne Skiff and built by ADAM & SON of Gourock in 1964. She was originally rigged with a standing lug and stemhead jib, but she was late converted to Gaff main, and a bowsprit added in 1966. In 1973, she had a 1935 Kelvin petrol-parafin auxiliary.

ROSE OF ARGYLL has raced in C.C.C. events and is cruised extensively on the West Coast.

N.B. Watch out for "ROSE's" spinaker boom, it is very sharp in a close quarter situation!
boat.name: Rose of Argyll
reference: Log Clyde and West Coast of Scotland
boat.short_description: Designed along the lines of a Loch Fyne skiff
